item.title: Complexity Economics: Overview
item.description: Critique of Traditional Economics E.g. Sugarscape 1st difference: Dynamics Traditional: Closed, static, linear systems in equilibrium Complexity: Open, dynamic, non-linear systems far from equilibrium 2nd difference: Agents Traditional: Modeled collectively (homogenous) Use complex deductive calculations to make decisions Have complete information Random errors (no biases) No learning or adaptation (already optimal) Complexity: Modeled individually (heterogenous) Use inductive heuristics to make decisions Have incomplete information Some biases Learn and adapt over time 3rd difference: Networks Traditional:
